intro: Leptocnide heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved leptocnide, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its alternate, pinnately compound leaves that vary in shape depending on the growth conditions. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
